text: This was too reminiscent of the nursemaid and her illegitimate baby. For the most part, Mr. Godber muttered his way through a cliche-ridden Foreign Office brief. He resembles the elephant seal, an otherwise endearing creature whose articulation is limited, we are told, to a series of heavy sighs. Sir Lynn Ungoed-Thomas, M.P. for Leicester N.E., a former Labour Solicitor-General, and Mrs. Barbara Castle, M.P. for Blackburn, a member of the Labour party National Executive, delivered a letter to Mr. Soldatov, the Russian Ambassador, last night protesting against the Russian nuclear tests.
handwritten_text: This was too reminiscent of the nursemaid and her illegitimate baby. For the most part, Mr. Godber muttered his way through a cliche-ridden Foreign Office brief. He resembles the elephant seal, an otherwise endearing creature whose articulation is limited, we are told, to a series of heavy sighs. Sir Lynn Ungoed-Thomas, M.P. for Leicester N.E., a former Labour Solicitor-General, and Mrs. Barbara Castle, M.P. for Blackburn, a member of the Labour party National Executive, delivered a letter to Mr. Soldatov, the Russian Ambassador, last night protesting against the Russian nuclear tests.
